detaileddescription.para: Event function of the CsH module. The function provides the response to Kessy for Challenge Generation request.

This function is called by KessyEventMngr to minimize the overhead on reaction for the function call. CryptoHandler shall report the result of challenge generation to the calling application on the client-server interface by triggering Rte_Call_CsH_KYBCM_Ev_StCryptoKY_evCalcChallengeResp.
reentrant No context Rte layer thread safe Yes multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core asynchronous
Function is called by Kessy SWC
N/A
void
void
Globals
rawChallengeResult - Buffer used for a raw Challenge generation numCalcChallengeStatus - Status of a raw Challenge generation
Input->Output-Correlation
Result of challenge generation gets provided via RTE to Kessy SWC
Call Sequence
Test Method
SWATT unit test TEST_CsH_Call_Ev_StCryptoKY_evCalcChallengeResp
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements or Design Decision:
Satisfies requirement

SWR_ICAS1_L3_CRY_544
This is the server function for handling the Encryption request from Kessy

The function triggers the encryption of the rawInputData over the CSM (Crypto Stack) using the selected cryptographical key type (either FFB_SKC, RSAD_SKC or rawKey value). The result of the encryption is stored in the u8rawEncryptResult buffer. Afterwards, Kessy receives the encryption result over the KessyEventMngr.
reentrant No context task thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
Function called by Kessy component lib
N/A
uint8*
rawInputData - pointer to the data to encrypt [in] uint8 enSKC - enum denoting the selected cryptographical key type [in] uint8* rawKey - pointer to data containing rawKey, being the one of the cryptographical key type
Std_ReturnType retval - RTE Status for evaluated operation.
Globals
u8rawEncryptResult - Buffer for the Encryption Process Result. u32rawEncryptResultLength - Length of the Encryption Process Result. Standby_CsH_FfbSkc - FFB SKC variables stored in Standby RAM.
Input->Output-Correlation
Input data determines RTE Status return value Activity Diagram evEncryptReq
Test Method
SWATT unit test TEST_evEncryptReq
Traceability

Satisfies requirement

This is the server function for handling the Encryption request from Kessy
Please find detail information in header file.
This is the server function for handling the Challenge Generation request from Kessy

The function triggers the Challenge Generation via the CSM (Crypto Stack) . The result of the Challenge Generation is stored in the rawChallengeResult buffer. Afterwards, Kessy receives the generated Challenge result over the KessyEventMngr. This function attempts to generate the real random number via HW module. In case an access to the HW module is rejected at the time of the request (due to e.g., other function requests), retry mechanism is used - RANDOM_NUMBER_COUNT attempts are possible. Eventually, random number pre-generated during runtime and stored in Standby RAM is used. This mechanism is designed for the purpose of wake-up from deep sleep, when multiple functions try to generate the random numbers and the access to HW crypto module may be limited.
reentrant Yes - More in details section context task thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
Received request from Kessy
N/A
void
Std_ReturnType retval - RTE Status for evaluated operation.
Globals
rawChallengeResult - Buffer used for a raw Challenge generation. numCalcChallengeStatus - Status of a raw Challenge generation. Standby_CsH_FfbSkc - FFB SKC variables stored in Standby RAM. randomNumberUsed_counter - Counter of random number usage times. randomGenereted_Standby_Status - Random Generated number status variables stored in Standby RAM.
Input->Output-Correlation
Input data determines RTE Status return value.
Call Sequence
Test Method
SWATT unit test TEST_evCalcChallengeReq
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_L3_CRY_613
SWR_ICAS1_L3_CRY_414
SWR_ICAS1_L3_CRY_555

memberdef.name: evCalcSignatureReq

detaileddescription.para: This is the server function for handling the Signature Calculation request from Kessy

The function triggers the Signature Calculation on the data provided as arguments via the CSM (Crypto Stack) using the FFB_SKC cryptographical key. The result of the Signature Calculation is stored in the rawSignatureResult buffer. Afterwards, Kessy receives the encryption result over the KessyEventMngr.
reentrant No context task thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
Received request from Kessy
N/A
boolean
bMarkerDirection - value passed by Kessy [in] pointer of rawFreshnessValue array - value passed by Kessy [in] pointer of rawNutzdaten array - value passed by Kessy [in] uint8 numNutzdatenLength - length of the rawNutzdaten array
Std_ReturnType retval - RTE Status for evaluated operation.
Globals
u32rawEncryptResultLength - Buffer for a Signature Check result rawSignatureResult - Buffer for a Signature Check result numCalcSignatureStatus - Status of a Signature Check result u8rawEncryptResult - Buffer for the Encryption Process Result u8CalcSignatureReqBuffer - Buffer for CalcSignature Req
Input->Output-Correlation
Input data determines RTE Status return value.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8 *rawInputData, uint8 numInputDataLength, const uint8 *rawSignatureToCheck, uint8 numSignatureLength)
memberdef.name: evCheckRSADSignatureReq

detaileddescription.para: This is the server function for handling the RSAD Signature Check request from Kessy

The function triggers the RSAD Signature Calculation on the rawInputData via the CSM (Crypto Stack) using the RSAD_SKC cryptographical key and compares the generated signature with the signature provided by Kessy in rawSignatureToCheck. The result of the signatures comparison is stored in the bRSASignatureValid. Afterwards, Kessy receives the signature check result over the KessyEventMngr.
reentrant No context task thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous
Function called by Kessy component lib.
N/A
uint8*
rawInputData - pointer to rawInpuData. [in] uint8 numInputDataLength - rawInputData length. [in] uint8* rawSignatureToCheck - pointer to rawSignatureToCheck data. [in] uint8 numSignatureLength - rawSignatureToCheck length.
Std_ReturnType retval - RTE Status for evaluated operation.
Globals
bRSASignatureValid - Boolean value denoting RSAD Signature validness numCheckRSASignatureStatus - Status of a RSAD Signature Check result
Input->Output-Correlation
Input data determines RTE Status return value. Activity Diagram evCheckRSADSignatureReq
Test Method
SWATT unit test TEST_evCheckRSADSignatureReq
Traceability
Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:
Satisfies requirement

memberdef.name: CheckSignature_ZKA

detaileddescription.para: This is the server function for handling the Signature Check request from FDH

The function triggers the Signature Calculation on the input vector consisting of function arguments via the CSM (Crypto Stack) using the FFB_SKC cryptographical key and compares the generated signature with the signature provided by FDH in rawSignatureToCheck. The result of the signatures comparison is stored in the bZKASignatureValid.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
Request sent from FFB Data Handler
N/A
boolean
bMarkerDirection - component of the input vector used for signature calculation [in] pointer of rawFreshnessValue array - component of the input vector used for signature calculation [in] pointer of rawNutzdaten array - component of the input vector used for signature calculation [in] uint8 numNutzdatenLength - length of rawNutzdaten [in] pointer of rawSignatureToCheck array - pointer to the array containing Signature passed by FDH [in] uint8 umSignatureLength - length of the Signature passed by FDH
Std_ReturnType retval - RTE Status for evaluated operation.
Globals
u8CheckSignatureReqBuffer - Buffer for CheckSignature Req
Input->Output-Correlation
The result of the signatures comparison is provided to FDH.
